The dry conditions and any lightning strikes can produce new fires in the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR FOOTHILLS OF NORTHEAST WASHINGTON, COLUMBIA
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia Basin, Palouse, Spokane Area; Foothills of Northeast Washington; Western Columbia Basin

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 6:27AM PDT until July 10 at 6:15PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:46PM CDT until July 11 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR EAST CENTRAL DUNN AND WESTERN CHIPPEWA COUNTIES HAS EXPIRED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been allowed to expire. However small hail is still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 10 at 7:45PM CDT until July 10 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Pepin County in west central Wisconsin... Pierce County in west central Wisconsin... Southwestern Dunn County in west central Wisconsin... * Until 830 PM CDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oneida County through 815 PM CDT... At 739 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Newbold, or 12 miles west of Rhinelander, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN PRICE COUNTY THROUGH 800 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Catawba, or 22 miles northwest of Medford, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:33PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Taylor County through 800 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawkins, or 20 miles east of Ladysmith, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
